DataElement.preferredName: Dose Modification Meddra System Organ Class Reason
DataElement.preferredDefinition: an explanation based on the highest level of terminology and distinguished by anatomical or physiological system, etiology, or purpose from an international medical terminology designed to support the classification, retrieval, presentation, and communication of medical information throughout the medical product regulatory cycle related to dose modification.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A quantity of an agent (such as substance or energy) administered, taken, or absorbed at one time.:The act of alteration or modification; changed or altered in form or character.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The amount of medicine taken, or radiation given, at one time.

Concepts.definition: A quantity of an agent (such as substance or energy) administered, taken, or absorbed at one time.
The act of alteration or modification; changed or altered in form or character.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: an explanation of the cause by the highest level of terminology and distinguished by anatomical or physiological system, etiology, or purpose from an international medical terminology designed to support the classification, retrieval, presentation, and communication of medical information throughout the medical product regulatory cycle.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Any stepwise set of actions.

Concepts.definition: Any stepwise set of actions.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A non-neoplastic or neoplastic disorder affecting the arteries, veins, or lymphatic vessels. Examples include vasculitis, thrombophlebitis, arteriosclerosis, lymphedema, hemangioma, and angiosarcoma.

Concepts.definition: A non-neoplastic or neoplastic disorder affecting the arteries, veins, or lymphatic vessels. Examples include vasculitis, thrombophlebitis, arteriosclerosis, lymphedema, hemangioma, and angiosarcoma.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Any deviation from the normal structure or function of the blood or lymphatic system that is manifested by a characteristic set of symptoms and signs.

Concepts.definition: A non-neoplastic or neoplastic disorder that affects the hematopoietic and lymphatic system.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Any deviation from the normal structure or function of the cardiac system that is manifested by a characteristic set of symptoms and signs.

Concepts.definition: A non-neoplastic or neoplastic disorder that affects the heart and/or the pericardium. Representative examples include endocarditis, pericarditis, atrial myxoma, cardiac myeloid sarcoma, and pericardial malignant mesothelioma.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Congenital, Familial and Genetic Disorder Class

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Congenital, Familial and Genetic Disorder Class
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A class of disorders that encompasses conditions resulting from a congenital, familial hereditary trait or genetic abnormality as is manifested by a characteristic set of symptoms and signs.

Concepts.longName: Congenital, Familial and Genetic Disorder Class
Concepts.definition: A class of disorders that encompasses conditions resulting from a congenital, familial hereditary trait or genetic abnormality as is manifested by a characteristic set of symptoms and signs.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Any deviation from the normal structure or function of the ear or labyrinth that is manifested by a characteristic set of symptoms and signs.

Concepts.definition: Any deviation from the normal structure or function of the ear or labyrinth that is manifested by a characteristic set of symptoms and signs.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A non-neoplastic or neoplastic disorder that affects the endocrine system. Representative examples of non-neoplastic disorders include diabetes mellitus, hyperthyroidism, and adrenal gland insufficiency. Representative examples of neoplastic disorders include carcinoid tumor, neuroendocrine carcinoma, and pheochromocytoma.

Concepts.definition: A non-neoplastic or neoplastic disorder that affects the endocrine system. Representative examples of non-neoplastic disorders include diabetes mellitus, hyperthyroidism, and adrenal gland insufficiency. Representative examples of neoplastic disorders include carcinoid tumor, neuroendocrine carcinoma, and pheochromocytoma.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A non-neoplastic or neoplastic disorder that affects the eye. Representative examples include conjunctivitis, glaucoma, cataract, conjunctival squamous cell carcinoma, uveal melanoma, and retinoblastoma.

Concepts.definition: A non-neoplastic or neoplastic disorder that affects the eye. Representative examples include conjunctivitis, glaucoma, cataract, conjunctival squamous cell carcinoma, uveal melanoma, and retinoblastoma.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A non-neoplastic or neoplastic disorder that affects the gastrointestinal tract, anus, liver, biliary system, and pancreas.

Concepts.definition: A non-neoplastic or neoplastic disorder that affects the gastrointestinal tract, anus, liver, biliary system, and pancreas.

PermissibleValues.value: General disorders and administration site conditions
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: General Disorders and Administration Site Conditions Class

ValueMeaning.preferredName: General Disorders and Administration Site Conditions Class
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A class of disorders that encompasses conditions of a general kind that result from a disease, the treatment of disease or administration of treatment at a particular site and are manifested by a characteristic set of symptoms and signs.

Concepts.longName: General Disorders and Administration Site Conditions Class
Concepts.definition: A class of disorders that encompasses conditions of a general kind that result from a disease, the treatment of disease or administration of treatment at a particular site and are manifested by a characteristic set of symptoms and signs.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A non-neoplastic or neoplastic disorder that affects the liver, bile ducts, and gallbladder. Representative examples of non-neoplastic disorders include hepatitis, cirrhosis, cholangitis, and cholecystitis. Representative examples of neoplastic disorders include hepatocellular adenoma, hepatocellular carcinoma, and cholangiocarcinoma.

Concepts.definition: A non-neoplastic or neoplastic disorder that affects the liver, bile ducts, and gallbladder. Representative examples of non-neoplastic disorders include hepatitis, cirrhosis, cholangitis, and cholecystitis. Representative examples of neoplastic disorders include hepatocellular adenoma, hepatocellular carcinoma, and cholangiocarcinoma.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A disorder resulting from an abnormality in the immune system. -- 2003

Concepts.definition: A disorder resulting from an abnormality in the immune system.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A disorder resulting from the presence and activity of a microbial, viral, or parasitic agent. It can be transmitted by direct or indirect contact. -- 2003

Concepts.definition: A disorder resulting from the presence and activity of a microbial, viral, fungal, or parasitic agent. It can be transmitted by direct or indirect contact.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Injury, Poisoning and Procedural Complication Class

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Injury, Poisoning and Procedural Complication Class
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A class of disorders that encompasses conditions resulting from an injury, poisoning or procedure.

Concepts.longName: Injury, Poisoning and Procedural Complication Class
Concepts.definition: A class of disorders that encompasses conditions resulting from an injury, poisoning or procedure.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The act or process of a systematic and thorough examination; research, study; the process of inquiring into or following up, intended to develop facts.

Concepts.definition: The act or process of a systematic and thorough examination; research, study; the process of inquiring into or following up, intended to develop facts.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A class of disorders that encompasses conditions occurring as a result of metabolic dysfunction or deviation from the normal nutritional requirements.

Concepts.definition: A class of disorders that encompasses conditions occurring as a result of metabolic dysfunction or deviation from the normal nutritional requirements.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A non-neoplastic or neoplastic disorder that affects the connective and soft tissue.

Concepts.definition: A non-neoplastic or neoplastic disorder that affects the connective and soft tissue.

PermissibleValues.value: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A benign or malignant tissue growth resulting from uncontrolled cell proliferation. Benign neoplastic cells resemble normal cells without exhibiting significant cytologic atypia, while malignant cells exhibit overt signs such as dysplastic features, atypical mitotic figures, necrosis, nuclear pleomorphism, and anaplasia. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include papillomas, cystadenomas, and lipomas; malignant neoplasms include carcinomas, sarcomas, lymphomas, and leukemias.

Concepts.definition: A benign or malignant tissue growth resulting from uncontrolled cell proliferation. Benign neoplastic cells resemble normal cells without exhibiting significant cytologic atypia, while malignant cells exhibit overt signs such as dysplastic features, atypical mitotic figures, necrosis, nuclear pleomorphism, and anaplasia. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include papillomas, cystadenomas, and lipomas; malignant neoplasms include carcinomas, sarcomas, lymphomas, and leukemias.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Diseases of the central and peripheral nervous system. This includes disorders of the brain, spinal cord, cranial nerves, peripheral nerves, nerve roots, autonomic nervous system, neuromuscular junction, and muscle.

Concepts.definition: A non-neoplastic or neoplastic disorder that affects the brain, spinal cord, or peripheral nerves.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Pregnancy, Puerperium and Perinatal Condition Class

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Pregnancy, Puerperium and Perinatal Condition Class
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A class of conditions associated with pregnancy, puerperium and perinatal status.

Concepts.longName: Pregnancy, Puerperium and Perinatal Condition Class
Concepts.definition: A class of conditions associated with pregnancy, puerperium and perinatal status.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Any deviation from the normal structure or function of the brain and a psychiatric condition, that results in an impairment of an individual's normal cognitive, emotional, or behavioral functioning, and is caused by physiological or psychosocial factors.

Concepts.definition: A disorder characterized by behavioral and/or psychological abnormalities, often accompanied by physical symptoms. The symptoms may cause clinically significant distress or impairment in social and occupational areas of functioning. Representative examples include anxiety disorders, cognitive disorders, mood disorders and schizophrenia.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Disorders of any part of the urologic system.

Concepts.definition: A non-neoplastic or neoplastic disorder affecting the urinary system.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Reproductive System and Breast Disorder Class

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Reproductive System and Breast Disorder Class
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Any deviation from the normal structure or function of the reproductive system or breast that is manifested by a characteristic set of symptoms and signs.

Concepts.longName: Reproductive System and Breast Disorder Class
Concepts.definition: Any deviation from the normal structure or function of the reproductive system or breast that is manifested by a characteristic set of symptoms and signs.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A non-neoplastic or neoplastic disorder that affects the respiratory system or the thorax including the mediastinum and the heart.

Concepts.definition: A non-neoplastic or neoplastic disorder that affects the respiratory system or the thoracic organs.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Any deviation from the normal structure or function of the skin or subcutaneous tissue that is manifested by a characteristic set of symptoms and signs.

Concepts.definition: Any deviation from the normal structure or function of the skin or subcutaneous tissue that is manifested by a characteristic set of symptoms and signs.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Pertaining to the demographic and psychosocial environment in which a person lives.

Concepts.definition: Pertaining to the demographic and psychosocial environment in which a person lives.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Highest level of the terminology, and distinguished by anatomical or physiological system, etiology, or purpose.:An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.

Concepts.definition: Highest level of the MedDRA terminology, and distinguished by anatomical or physiological system, etiology, or purpose.
An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.

ValueDomain.origin: CALGB CRF:Cancer and Leukemia Group B Case Report Form

DataElement.origin: CALGB CRF:Cancer and Leukemia Group B Case Report Form
